column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: During 2021, Ampol implemented a specific modern slavery procurement risk assessment and mitigation procedure to assist Ampol employees and contractors in evaluating supply chain risks. The procedure provides a framework for assessing and addressing modern slavery risks when purchasing goods and services.

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column7: The deep dives and detailed modern slavery questionnaires have provided Ampol with better visibility into the nature of the risks in the various parts of its operations and supply chains and what Ampol and its suppliers are doing to manage these risks.

Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: Our Ampol Leadership Team participated in a cultural competency session with Shelley Reys, AO, CEO of Arrilla Indigenous Consulting. We followed this up by engaging Paul Sinclair from Mirri Mirri Indigenous Consulting to host several cultural awareness sessions for over 150 Australian-based senior leaders to encourage conversation and increase understanding, value and recognition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture.

column6: Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column13: As Australia and New Zealand's largest transport fuel supplier and one of the largest convenience retailers in the region, we recognise that we have a role to play in respecting and advancing human rights. Ampol is committed to conducting its business in a way that respects human rights, including those of our employees, customers, suppliers, and the communities in which we operate.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Since 1993, we have proudly supported the iconic Westpac Rescue Helicopter service. The service is on standby 24/7 to help save lives from Hawkesbury to the Queensland border by delivering the highest standard of aeromedical and rescue services to those in need. Through our charitable arm, the Ampol Foundation, we can support the initiative through critical fundraising efforts and the supply of AmpolCard and aviation fuel to their fleet of six helicopters through a discount arrangement.\t

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column8: Z Energy's Good In The Hood program
column13: During 2023, Z Energy reviewed its flagship community program, Good In The Hood, to ensure the NZ$1 million provided every year had a meaningful impact on local communities. Throughout the year, 517 community organisations (mostly charities) nominated by their local communities received donations following customer voting at Z retail sites.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In April, we extended our partnership with Street Side Medics, a general practitioner-led mobile medical service launched in 2020 and led by 2022 Young Australian of the Year, Dr Daniel Nour. Street Side Medics aims to deliver primary healthcare to the most vulnerable people in New South Wales. By becoming one of our eight strategic Ampol Foundation partners, we assist Street Side Medics by providing much-needed fuel and matching dollar-for-dollar to our employees and pre-tax donations as part of our Fuelling Change workplace giving program.\t

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: In August 2023, Ampol entered into an enforceable undertaking with the New South Wales Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) relating to an incident in April 2022 at Ampol's Kurnell fuel transfer terminal, which resulted in hydrocarbon-impacted floodwaters escaping from the terminal. Ampol contributed $700,000 towards four projects to enhance and improve the local environment and community.

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: As Australia's leading transport fuels provider that operates in hundreds of communities across the country, we are passionate about keeping people and customers safe and remain dedicated to improving access to education among disadvantaged youth. The Ampol Foundation had yet another successful year with three key fundraising campaigns executed across our retail network. Thanks to the generosity of loyal customers and selected suppliers, Ampol raised over $1.2 million for crucial charity partners The Smith Family, Surf Life Saving Australia and Sebastian Foundation.

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities

column13: In 2022, Z Energy rolled out a tailored version of a modern slavery awareness training module across New Zealand for contract managers and supplier managers to help them align with Ampol's commitments to human rights.

Political contributions
column7: Political contributions in 2023 were $87,225.00. Ampol does not donate cash to political parties, politicians, elected officials, election committees, or candidates for public office in any country without prior approval from the Managing Director and CEO. Proposed political donations will only be approved if they comply with relevant laws, regulations, and regulatory obligations that apply to the Ampol business.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column7: National Polluting Inventory (NPI) annual reporting requirements are for the reporting period between 1 January and 31 December to match the environmental licencing requirements for Lytton refinery only. These figures are due to the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water by 31 March annually.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column13: As cost-of-living pressures took hold, the convenience shopper of 2023 sought value for money. Recognising this, we introduced the Crave' n Save promotion, which offers customers more value for their money with different monthly combo deals and discounted prices.\t
column20: Promotions, Value for money, Customer satisfaction

column6: Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column8: Flip to Win' Premium Fuels promotion.
column13: We also broke new ground in 2023 through our 'Flip to Win' Premium Fuels promotion, the first campaign to be launched across the entirety of the Ampol-branded network. The Q4 promotion received over 179,000 entries and was driven by a simple digital game that offered customers the chance to flip a digital coin to win physical AmpolCash (up to the value of $100 when they spent more than $30 on Amplify Premium Fuel) and a weekly opportunity to win free fuel for a year.

column7: Ampol continued to improve its cyber security governance and risk management by conducting an independent National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) assessment in 2023 (which continued to improve) and rolled out an uplift program informed by that assessment across the Group.
